column1: 130kph, beaten outside the off stump by a length ball angled across. No swing, it nipped away
135kph, good length, hint of shape but mostly holds it's line and he leaves
133kph, good length, shaping back nicely into off, he presents the full face and pushes this towards mid on
129kph, perfect length, shaping back a touch, he defends half forward into the on side
swing and miss driving at a wide 129kph delivery angled way across him
134kph/83mph, back of a length on off, he's jumping back and defending to mid off
134kph, back of a length, some bounce outside off, he's jumping back and across and defending to cover-point
pulled off the hip behind square! 137kph, into the hip, he got back and pulled with great control placing it behind square and it raced away!
139kph, good length top of off, he is back and defending with soft hands towards mid off and immediately calls for a quick single
139kph, shorter and swinging down leg and rightly called wide
beaten by a cracking 140kph, length ball and nipped across on the angle and squared Finch up on the back foot
133kph, shorter outside off, he's jumping back and across knocking this down
fuller on leg, 138kph, hint of shape in, he bunts this into midwicket off the front foot
133kph, good length, angled across, he's happy to leave watchfully
135kph, over-pitched, Finch climbs into a powerful off drive, Shoaib Malik at mid off misfields, it bursts out of his hands and away for a couple
shorter length, he's back and defending to cover, bat was away from the body
beaten, 135kph, good length, nipping across, he plays the line but doesn't follow as it zips past the edge
130kph, shorter on middle, he jumps back and turns this behind square for a single
beaten, 133kph, good length, touch of shape away outside off, Warner's feet were anchored and he poked at it but it didn't catch the edge
smashed over square leg into the stands! Crack! This was banged in at 143kph but it sat up, he was waiting and smashed a pull shot flat over midwicket and it went 10 rows back!
141kph, short outside off, Finch is up on the toes punching off the back foot very well wide of mid off for a couple
135kph, fuller into leg stump, he tucks this behind square off the front foot, they run well to pinch a couple
edged but it goes wide of second and runs to third man. 140kph, good length, nipping away, he hung the bat out but the thick edge flew safely through fifth slip region
thumped through midwicket! 141kph hit me short ball, Warner, says thankyou and I'll crack this through midwicket with ease!
half volley, outside off, Warner doesn't move his feet but he times a push very well through cover, it nearly runs all the way but the boundary is so small they only get two
137kph, good length, angled across and angling further, Finch leaves
137kph, good length, fourth stump line, angled across, decisive leave on the front foot
back of a length, outside off, he jumps back and across and defends
128kph, good length, nipping back, he's half forward gets a thick inside edge onto pad. He was late getting the bat down
135kph, good length angled well wide and Finch leaves
beaten fending away from the body at ball that nips away sharply well wide of off
134kph, back of a length, gathers pace off the surface and hits him on the thigh pad as he tries to work to leg
136kph, back of a length on middle and leg, he is again taken on the thigh guard trying to work to leg
139kph, fuller on middle, he's forward defending into the on side
135kph, back of a length, nipping away, he's squared up and beaten, beautifully bowled
134kph, short and lifting into the ribs, he's back and knocking this down well behind square
141kph, fuller, he drives well but Hassan's knocks it down in his follow through
133kph, wide of the crease, angled down the leg side and a wide
lovely glance off the pads! Too straight on leg stump, Warner held his balance and clipped it off the oads through square leg with superb timing
136kph, good length, angled into middle and off, he defends from the crease off the inside half of the bat and it runs behind square
128kph, shorter length, on off, he's jumping back and across and knocking into the on side
good length, 134kph, angled across, he sits back and late cuts with control to third man
134kph, good length, angled into off, he defends half forward, gets a thick inside edge, with the bat well infront of pads and it runs to fine leg
back of a length, top of off, he's jumping back and across and defends
140kph, full down the leg side, Sarfaraz is diving and not gloving it cleanly but no bye is available
137kph, shorter on leg, he's back and working this neatly behind square
140kph, fuller length, he's half forward, pushing, gets a thick inside edge but it doesn't squeeze through, it comes off pad and rolls to gully
square drive on the up! This is some shot! There was width but it wasn't a volley, he leaned into it and drove with the chest open, thumping it through point
straighter on leg, he is back and working this to wide fine leg
lovely back foot punch! Just a bottom hand jab to a short of a length ball wide of off. Placement and timing were from the top shelf
good length, angled across, he leaves this alone
132kph, shorter into the ribs, he's back and knocking this down into the leg side for one
134kph, full on off, he pushes on the front foot wide of mid off for a single
134kph, back of a length, fourth stump, he's back and across and defending to cover
fuller, 141kph, on off, he pushes to cover, calls yes then no, Warner has to scamper back but he's home comfortably
141kph, fuller length, fifth stump line, he pushes firmly on the front foot to mid off
beaten by a 143kph, good length delivery angled across and nipping further as Finch was stuck on the crease jabbing at it
half volley, driven firmly back at Hassan, he gets a touch with the right hand and saves a boundary as the timing is superb, it nearly runs all the way anyway
short into the ribs, he jumps back and jabs at it and it runs fine away for four leg byes off the body
131kph, good length on leg, he tucks this through square leg for a single
140kph, fuller length outside off, Finch steps forward and plays a quality cover drive straight to cover
136kph, back of a length, he's jumping back and across and knocking this down to midwicket
139kph back of a length, he's punching off the back foot to backward point but Babar makes a good save
leading edge pops up short of backward point. That climbed off a length, he fended at it but it fell safely
good length on off, he's back and defending
139kph, good length, this climbs off a length, Warner knocks it down awkwardly. That surprised him
135kph, short and wide, he's back and cracking a cut to deep cover-point
137kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and across, pushing this to mid on and pinching one
half volley on leg stump, a gift, Warner just ease this through midwicket, with control for a couple
good length, angled across, he is happy to leave on length and line
139kph, full and straight, he's sitting back and clips this neatly through midwicket for a couple
140kph, good length on leg, he's taken on the thigh guard, it's high and not hitting the stumps, it rolls behind square for a leg bye
142kph, over-pitched, Warner plays a lovely cover drive, just a push, Imam has to sprint from deep cover-point to dive and save four
good length, 140kph, top of off, Warner pushes from the crease to cover
good length, middle stump, 142kph, he's defending from the crease back to the bowler
134kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working this forward of square
138kph, good length outside off, he drives without timing to cover
137kph, good length outside off, he's forward opening the face and running this to the gap at gully

dropped by Asif at slip! Finch was back to a good length ball angled across, trying to thrash this through point with an angled back, thick edge flew head high to Asif Ali at first and it bursts through his hands for four!
short on the hip, he glances this fine past the keeper! Salt in the wounds. Too straight and Finch adds four more just tickling it fine
shorter on off, he's back and working this behind square
full on leg, he's hanging back and flicking this behind square
134kph, high bouncer, he tries to upper cut and over first slip but misses
back of a length, 139kph, wide of off, he's back and late cutting to wide third man
shorter length, he's back and working this against the angle through midwicket
140kph, short on the hip and he pulls beautifully into the gap behind square! Control and placement the key here. He played that very well
138kph, back of a length, top of off, he's back and defending
shorter length, he's back working this through midwicket to the gap and they run well

huge appeal for LBW given not out. Pakistan review. He was hit deep in the crease just at the top of the pad. No bat. It pitched in line, hit in line, just clipping the stumps! Not out because it's umpire's call! Pakistan retain the review. That was closer than it looked live. It looked like it might have pitched outside leg
shorter length, he's back and defending to cover
141kph, this rears off the length and hits him in the shoulder! That was nasty! It really climbed off a length

nearly a run out! Then an overthrow. It was full and wide, he steered it to Babar at backward point and took off, Warner sent him back, he had to dive back to beat the throw but no one was backing up in the ring so they get a run
full and speared down the leg side
137kph, full on middle, he jams the bat down in defence
good length, 141kph, angled across, he leaves this alone
beaten by a 140kph ball tight to off, he was hanging back and it zipped between bat and pad and past off
another LBW appeal but it's not out and Sarfaraz isn't interested. It pitched outside and was too high. Finch was hanging back
very full, 143kph, on off, he's defending from the crease back to the bowler
good length, 142kph, on off, he's defending half forward
driven straight of mid on and Shoaib misses it! Nice stroke but Shoaib made a meal of it diving to his left and he went all over it
full and drifting down leg, in comes off pad and runs fine
edged and dropped by Sarfaraz! Shorter and he tries to cut, gets a thick edge and Sarfaraz can't claim it. Tough chance. It was a solid deflection
down the track and smoking this through Hafeez straight down the ground!
short, he's back and cracking this through point with power!
launched over wide long on and way back! Tossed up and this is juts a step hit, he lofts it through the line over wide long on into the crowd
shorter on leg, he's back and tucking this behind square for a single
full, and straight, punched straight back down the pitch, looping over the bowler's head and into the non-striker's stumps
pushed onto the back foot by a tight leg-stump line, but that's an over-step, and a free hit coming up ...
very full and straight, well bowled in the circumstances, clubbed hard into the covers but straight to the fielder
a hint of width, chopped with urgency through point and some sharp running as the sweeper skids round to intercept on the edge of the rope
hint of nip back off the deck, inside-edged to backward square with an 'urgh' that betrays the fact that he was beaten by that one... no damage done
round the wicket, and that's a beauty! Fading into the right-hander, nip off the seam once more, and beats the outside edge of a limp prod
hops across the stumps to clip a single to midwicket. It's all Australia at the moment ...
down on one knee for the sweep, no contact
sliding back into the crease, defended back to the bowler
a quickstep down the track, clipped off the pad, another single to backward square
half a yard too short, Warner rocks back to slap a drive past short cover, a slight misfield allowing the single
flipped off the toes to the leg side
on the pads, misses the bat but takes the deflection. More runs to the cause
round the wicket, hitting the deck hard outside off, and helped with the angle off the pads to the leg side
over the wicket, angled into the right-hander, very full length, nurdled to midwicket
extra heat in that delivery, Finch loses his bottom hand in a fence into the gap on the leg side
stretching forward, driven to mid-off
urgent running from Warner, head right over the ball as he works the gap in the covers and sets off for an instant single
back of a length, pressed to cover
boshed out to the cover sweeper
nudged to midwicket, can't make the angle this time
clears the front dog and goes 'woof!' into the stands! That's massive, high over long-on, just in the slot to be slogged!
spanked with insolence over cow corner! Hard, flat, pelted over the short boundary!
slower delivery, more flight outside off, dabbed behind point
good finish, head over the ball as Warner leans forward to defend
short, leg-sided, whisked behind square with a roll of the wrists
snorter! That's unplayable! Round the wicket, angled into the left-hander, pitched and bounced and kept seaming to saw Warner in half! There's something in that deck when you find the right areas...
oh dear, anoither free hit coming up
clears the front leg for a massive wind-up, but can't get the shot past mid-on
on the back foot, nudged to the leg side
tapped into the covers off the back foot
opens the face for a slam to the backward-point rope, that is Warner's fifty, and the resident bat-guitarist belts out some AC/DC to celebrate!

smashed high and hard, a fat leading edge, into the covers, Amir makes the breakthrough as Hafeez runs back to pouch a steepler! Not quite to the pitch of that one, as he sized up midwicket, and pays the price
punched into the covers
off the mark straightaway with a nudge off the legs
beats the inside edge with a pearler! Lovely seam position, explodes off the deck outside off, and curls past the off stump!
and now the outside-edge gets its turn to be tortured! That's a Wasim-Akram-lite pair of deliveries, the inny, and the outy! Even the well-set Warner is clueless
gets bat on ball this time, a judicious poke into the covers
full length, full face, planted through long-off! Perfect full face of the bat, leaning his weight through the line. Lovely
this is terrific batting, a wider line but again a full length. Warner changes his alignment, leans into the covers this time. And pierces the field with aplomb!
round the wicket, speared down the leg side. It's not happening for Pakistan today
on the hips, a tuck to the leg side for the single
solid line and length, drawing a defensive stab in front of a precariously placed pad
wide line, hands firmly through the stroke, open face, and eased to the cover boundary!
hops across the pitch, leaves the ball with a ludicrous flourish, bat pointing at the bowler in his followthrough, like a Courtney Walsh impersonator
on the back foot, nurdled to the leg side
back and across
inside-edged block to short midwicket. A sharp single
premeditated slide across the stumps, a back-foot punch out to cover

huge appeal! And after an eternity, Sarfaraz calls for the review! It was certainly adjacent to the stumps, but he was playing a stroke, so couldn't possibly be lbw ... an inside-edge maybe? Nope. That is a very sketchy waste
zinger! Leaps off the deck, past the gloves as the batsman leans forward and is sent rearing backwards. Amir is making the ball talk, but luckily for Warner, he doesn't understand Urdu!
decent length to start his spell, drawing Smith forward on off stump
round the wicket, thumped hard through the line, no turn on offer so a free swing of the bat to mid-on
outside off, a cross-batted bosh to deep cover
a frantic swish around the front pad, sizing up deep midwicket, but can't make contact
flicked off the pads with more circumspection this time, and takes the single
dipping into the toes, clipped to mid-on, that's a decent first over
another sizzling delivery outside Warner's off stump! That combination of angle into the left-hander, allied to nip off the seam in no predictable direction, is playing havoc with his alignment!
leaning forward, pressed to the off side
short and fierce! Warner limboes inside the line as Sarfaraz takes at head height!
fenced into the leg side, Warner prods forward uneasily with bat and pad together, but a loose return gifts an overthrow! Oh dear...
hops wider on the crease, spearing the ball in towards middle and off. Warner squares up in defence to repel all boarders
nudged into the covers, meeting the full length with firm wrists. This duel is compelling viewing
round the wicket, lobbed onto a good length, Warner leans forward with a full face of the bat
squeezed to point, trying to steal the single but Smith is sent back! He'd have been safely home with the dive
tossed up, met on the full, caressed through the covers! Easy peasy
forward, pushed into the off side once more
round the wicket, a spinner's no-ball! Honestly, that's hopeless ... free hit ...
leans back, hauls a freebie pull high over long-on! It plops over the rope, into and out of the hands of a Pakistani spectator ... standards are low either side of the rope today ...
tucked out to backward square leg. The third most-expensive over of the innings, and Australia keep marching on
back of a length, flapped out to deep square leg
opens the face to steer another deflection into the off side
looped into the blockhole, Smith retreats to leg in an attempt to make some room through the covers

massive leading edge and Smith is gone! No spin, which is key, as Smith wipes across the line, sizing up midwicket but picking out extra cover. An identical dismissal to that of Finch, and Pakistan have a glimmer
slowly progressing hand grenade, Warner stays deep in his crease to defend for his life
solid tap into the covers, another single to keep the strike ... the umpire briefly looks like sending down a seven-ball over, but is belatedly reminded that he has miscounted
poked into the off side
fenced off the back foot
solid areas, pushed to the off side once more
well bowled again, straightening a touch on off stump, and blocked
full length, driven back to the bowler, who snaffles in his followthrough
hopping back towards the umpire, punched on the up into the covers. Shoaib is putting a set together to keep a handle on the scoring rate
round the wicket, a touch of turn, pressed to long-on
fenced on the up to the on side
using the feet to meet the pitch, a scurrying single to mid-on
back and across, punched from an off-stump line to midwicket
lots of air, dipping on the crease, crunched to cover
width, flashed to deep cover, it's tidy but unthreatening out there
extra bounce outside off, Warner lines up a crash through the covers but is beaten
firmly biffed into the covers, a decent tumbling stop on the edge of the rope from Shaheen
slow turn from back of a length, punched on the up to extra cover
short and wide, biffed to backward point, but without much timing or placement. Nevertheless, the 200 is up
one hand comes off the ball as Maxwell drives into the covers, and beats the short fielder for another single
compact punch back to the bowler
too short, and clobbered into the gap at midwicket! That's just easy pickings, choose your spot and slot it!
gets a touch greedy on the lofted drive, and pulls his stroke to the long-on fielder, on the bounce
defended on a tight line
advancing to meet the pitch, punched into the covers
too short, too easy! Maxwell picks the lack of length from the hand, strolls deep, deep into his crease, and butchers a pull in front of square!

elegance! Onto the front foot this time, a beautifully presented, full face of the bat, like a drinks waiter bending his knee to deliver a mojito. Over the rope, and talking of drinks ... made mine a double!
edged off the toe to fine third man! Short and wide, he tries to cut, gets a thick edge off the bottom of the bat and it runs fine
134kph, back of a length, wide of off, he cuts to wide third man for a single
139kph full angling across, he's hanging back, feet anchored, he drops the bat on it dragging it to midwicket

Bowled him! 141kph, full and straight and through the gaping gate! That's why you need pace to Maxwell. His feet were anchored, he was hanging back but exposing middle and off, he played outside the line, it went straight through the wide gate between bat and pad and crashed into the stumps!
143kph, low full toss, he gets a thick outside edge to third man
low full toss, 142kph, he checks a drive firmly to cover on the bounce
drifting to leg, he works this behind square, they look for two but it's not on
tossed up on leg, he skips down and drives inside out to long off
floated up on off, he pushes gently on the front foot to cover
shorter length, he's back and cutting hard to deep cover-point
short and wide, he's back and cutting to deep cover-point
floated up on off, 81kph, he is forced to defend from the crease to cover

edged between keeper and first slip! A hundred for Warner! He's ecstatic! His first since the ban and his 15th in ODI cricket. It was a good length, he was caught on the crease, pushing, edging, slip was wide and went straight between them. Warner's smile was broad and his celebration showed how much it meant
back of a length on off, he's punching this behind point wide of third man and he pushes hard to get two
play and miss trying to cut one that jags back in from wide of off
good length, 143kph, on off, he defends behind point for a single
fuller on off, he drives firmly to mid off
full again, 140kph, on off, he drives but mistimes back to the bowler
dropped at third man! This was short outside off, he just upper cut it straight to Asif Ali at third man and he drops a sitter at waist high! My goodness ... what can you say?
shorter length, he's back and opening the face to run it to third man
short ball, lifting outside off, he's fending and missing as it climbs past the edge
139kph, top of off, he's defending this to midwicket
half volley, he drives firmly on the front foot to mid off
back of a length on off, he's pushing it to point
full on middle, he turns this through forward square for a couple
140kph, lifting from a length, climbing over the outside edge as he tried to cut
short and fractionally wide, he late cuts to wide third man
back of a length, on off, he's caught on the crease and checks his shot and defends

caught at deep point! Imam holds on finally! This was fuller outside off, Warner tried to launch it down the ground, he sliced it high off a thick outside edge, it flew very high to deep point, Imam came in off the rope and takes the catch clutching it to his chest
141kph, angled into leg, it takes him on the pad and rolls behind square for a leg bye
145kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and opening the face to run it third man
141kph, good length, top of off, he's caught on the crease but defends
138kph, back of a length on off, he pulls with control to deep square for a single
141kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot with soft hands
139kph, full on leg stump, he clips this firmly through forward square to the sweeper
137kph, back of a length outside off, he stays leg side, opens the face and runs it to third man
good length, top of off, he pushes on the front foot to cover-point
139kph, fuller, angled into middle and off, he mistimes a drive to wide mid off but goes with the stroke
angled into leg stump, 139kph, he clips this nicely through midwicket, the man at deep square has to run around to cut it off, they get two
driven powerfully through mid off but sloppy fielding from Shoaib! That should have been stopped. Instead it raced away for four
138kph, fuller on off, he drives, manipulating the face to get it through cover-point to the sweeper
135kph, full on middle, he drives to mid on who is on the circle
good length, angled into off, he slices this off a thick outside edge along the ground to gully
pulled powerfully over mid on! 140kph chest high short ball outside off, he swivelled on it and slapped a pull shot over mid on and it went over the rope on the second bounce
opens the face and glides it fine of third man! Brilliant batting from Khawaja! It was short outside off, and the control to get it fine was very skilful, using the pace
short again outside off, he's running this off the back foot to third man
attempted yorker gone wrong! Full toss driven through cover with ease! It was a gift and he just had to place it in the gap and he did
short outside off, it climbs and beats the edge as he flashed a cut shot
length on the hip, he's back and glancing this fine for four! Too easy for Khawaja to pick that off
beaten outside off, he tries to run this to third man but is beaten by the angle
118kph, slower ball on the pads and he flicks this off the pads to deep square leg
138kph, full outside off, he square drives firmly to deep cover-point
132kph, pushed way wide of off, too wide for Khawaja to reach
fuller on off, he elegantly drives but straight to cover
135kph, back of a length, takes him on the backside, as he tries to pull, it runs fine for a leg bye

caught at mid off! It was a full length, it just stops in the surface a touch, he drives in the air straight to Wahab on the circle at mid off and he clutches onto it awkwardly! He held it and that's all that matters
131kph, yorker speared into off, he jams down and keeps it out
flash and miss trying to cut a ball too full but wide of off. It was 131kph and zipped through off th surface
130kph, outswinger, wide of off, he shapes to play but withdraws the bat late
good length, 131kph, top of off, he is back and punching this wide of mid on
swing and a miss trying to drive a 131kph fuller ball wide of off that swung back past the inside edge late
he drives firmly to cover, Hafeez shies at the non striker's needlessly and no one is backing up. They get two
140kph, angled in, good length, he's cramped and defending from the crease
141kph, full and angled into off, he's caught on the crease again defending
he drives to mid off and takes on the throw from Shoaib and beats it comfortably! Good running
119kph, slower ball off cutter, he plays it off the pitch, opening the face and running it to third man
driven between cover and mid off! he picked the 119kph slower ball, gave himself room and drove it into the gap with mid off up
120kph, slower ball, good length, it bites in the surface, he is forced to defend into the off side
shorter length into the hip, he pulls fine to fine leg

caught at long off by Shoaib! Amir again! Cross seam delivery, length on off, he tried to launch it over long on, he got under it as it stopped in the surface a touch, he skied it to long on, Shoaib is in from the rope and takes a comfortable catch
130kph, shorter outside off, he sits back and runs this to third man
full outside off, he drives powerfully to deep cover-point
good length, 117kph, slower ball, he defends off a thick outside edge to backward point and they get one
135kph, back of a length, angled into the hip, he's taken on the thigh guard
pulled over midwicket and into the gap! It was a short ball but not high enough, he pulled in the air, into the big gap at midwicket and it lands safely and reaches the rope
back of a length, 138kph, angled in, cramping him for room, he's taken on the thigh again
119kph, slower ball, he steps across and flicks this fine but Wahab makes a diving save on the rope and prevents two
144kph, back of a length outside off, he opens the face and runs it to third man
he punches off the back foot to cover-point
148kph, slung in full towards off, he swings hard and gets a thick inside edge that runs behind square

caught behind off the inside edge! Good catch by Sarfaraz low to his left. It was full outside off, Coulter-Nile had it feet anchored and played for more tail across, it held it's line, caught the inside edge, just missed off stump but Sarfaraz was sharp moving low to his left to claim it
141kph, good length, on off, he defends from the crease
145kph, short and angled across, climbing off a length, he misses trying to cut
138kph, cracking bouncer, Cummins nearly falls over backwards trying to duck underneath
full on leg stump, he clips this behind square to bring the 300 up
138kph, angled into middle, he pushes towards cover and they pinch one
141kph, full angled into off, he whips this from off stump to long on

caught behind! 134kph but this rears off a length and catches the gloves on the way through to the keeper! Good short ball, Cummins was surprised, tried to lean back and cut but the bounce and pace was too much, it comes off the gloves and an easy catch for the skipper
141kph, full on off, he is camped on the crease, gets a leading edge after closing the face and it runs to cover
137kph, short into the ribs, he's uncomfortable fending this away into the on side
136kph, cracking bouncer, he tries to pull but is beaten for pace and bounce
slower ball banged in, he pulls without control, it hangs in the air for a while but falls short of fine leg
slower ball angled into middle, he clips this behind square for a single

LBW! Superb yorker! Carey reviews. It was full and tailed into the front shoe, he got it out of the way but it hit the back pad infront of leg. No bat involved by the looks. Nothing on ultra edge. Ball tracking says ... OUT. Pitched in line, hitting in line, smashing leg stump! Good decision. Even better bowling.
129kph, good length angled across, he drives on the up through cover-point to the sweeper
full angled down leg, he flicks this fine of fine leg, Shaheen makes an excellent diving stop to save four

caught at long on! Five for Amir! He deserved that. he has single handedly dragged Pakistan back. This was full in the slot, but slightly off speed, he drives in the air flat down the ground but not long enough anf Shoaib takes the running catch
tight line and length, on the back foot, but an over-step! It's a free hit coming up! In fact, it shouldn't have been called, but too late now...
good wheels! Zipping through a wild pull, no contact whatsoever. Justice is done in the end
nibbling off the seam, that's a lovely line, beating a cautious back-foot prod
wicket-to-wicket line, blocked stoutly on an off-stump line, gathered at midwicket
poor ball, on the toes, clipped behind square but well enough gathered on the bounce by the sweeper
back of a length, off-stump line, tough to take on that sort of ball so Fakhar shoulders arms and accepts it as a sighter
sizzler! Pitches on the left-hander's off stump, goes with the angle, climbs past the outside edge as Fakhar holds his line
this one goes like a 88mph offbreak! Pitches on off, turns a mile off the seam
tapped back down the pitch
another one jags wickedly off the seam, as Imam plays inside the line with a vertical bat
stands tall on the back foot, solid defence back down the track, half a thought of a single but Starc swoops quickly to send Fakhar scurrying for his crease
over the wicket, outside off, hitting the seam and climbing through to the keeper as Imam drives uppishly with hard hands
huge appeal! Starc goes half a yard fuller, and suddenly that jag off the seam is right up to the edge of the bat. Did it graze through to the keeper? The Aussies decline the review

back of a length, the first hint of width of the innings, so Fakhar climbs into the cut with hard hands, Richardson at third man is expertly positioned and gobbles the flying edge. That was a sucker punch, and Pakistan's hopes of a composed start are already looking wobbly
on the back foot, cautiously blocked into the off side
through to the keeper on a tight off-stump line. Babar leaves well alone
full length, blocked on the back foot in front of all three stumps. Solidity is the order of the day
stand and deliver! Babar waits for the over-pitch outside off. No footwork, but none needed! Just launching the hands through the arc and away to the point boundary!
head over the ball, solid block
tapped into the covers, pressing forward from deep in the crease
back of a length, angled into the legs, nudged to midwicket
short, and clattered! Imam takes no prisoners with that pull! A decent bouncer, well directed, but he's right on top of the stroke, rifling it through square leg!
91mph, into the toes, but Imam is well placed to block it back down the pitch
tight line, back of a length, defended with a compact stance to mid-on
right up to the toes, hint of outswing, solidly into line to defend. Australia on top but signs of composure from Imam in that over
that is liquid cricket! Oozing through the covers with a sumptuous high elbow! Just a touch over-pitched and punished with alacrity!
back of a length outside off, anchored in the crease in anticipation of the short ball, and dabs down to gully from under the nose
solid once more, drawn forward from the crease by a length ball on off stump. Blocked
half-forward and defended again. Babar is staying very neutral in his footwork, refusing to commit forward or back
once again, playing it late under the eyeline, poked to cover
crashed through the covers! Another punishing flow of the bat, Babar serves notice that anything in his area will travel!
on the back foot, blocked down into the crease
outside off, and this one takes off from the deck! Another beauty, but Imam to his credit refuses to be drawn into a nibble as he holds the line of off stump
short, slashed, clear of the slips! Short again from Starc, but on a wider line. Imam's reflexive pull takes a fat toe-end and soars over the cordon!
too full, too obvious! Imam knew it was coming, the attempted yorker, but with no swing, it was a simple flick through the leg-side from a well-set, well-balanced batsman!
outside off, back of a length, and a cautious, judicious leave. No need to chase those!
full once again, but sliding into the pads, and clipped sweetly through fine leg! All of a sudden, Pakistan are galloping along!
very full, tailing into the timbers, blocked on the back foot
the sequence continues! Full, straight, open-faced, and a poised pongo-ing through the covers! He might as well have used a snooker cue to pot that one through the gap
back of a length, tighter line, dabbed down into the crease
fenced into the covers, a touch squared up by some nip off the deck
solid block, back to the bowler
on the legs, clipped to mid-on. Another dot-ball to extend the sequence ever further
finds the edge this time as Imam pushes with hard hands! But falls short of slip, surprisingly. That was a genuine nick
on the back foot, worked to the leg side
pinged off the pads, out through the leg side. Babar's bottom hand comes off the bat as he reaches round to time his clip, and it sizzles to the rope!
worked into the covers, off the back foot
short, pulled, another boundary? Nope, gathered at deep midwicket, and it's a rare single!
through to the keeper
squared up on the back foot, fenced down to third man
on the toes, sliding past the hip and helped on its way past a flat-footed Carey. Freebie runs
outside the left-hander's off stump this time, tapped down into the covers
on the back foot, pushed to cover
full face, and pushed on the up to mid-on
outside off, lifting off the deck a touch, and nudged down to third man
round the wicket, angled into the left-hander, Imam hops back and across to defend
back of a length, climbing past the shoulder of the bat as Imam curtain-rails inside the line
opens the face, guides down to third man with a hop back towards the square-leg umpire
chopped down from back of a length, and inches past the off stump! Lucky lucky...
similar line and length, leaping into the splice and fended into the off side
that's a freebie ball, angled into the legs, whipped with spring-loaded wrists around the corner and clean through the gap
nudged into the off side, tip and run
back of a length, outside off
that is a thing of beauty! Babar's timing has been like a jazz drummer today! A stunning on-drive, feet slightly splayed to allow a measured push through the line to whistle to the rope. Gorgeous
through to the keeper outside off stump

short, and slapped straight to Richardson on the fence! That's a body blow! Babar's drives alone were going to win this game at a canter. But he's lured into a response to the bouncer, and doesn't come close to getting his wrists over the ball. Dragged down from way over his head like an amateur fly-fisherman, and backward square is in business again
outside off, hits the seam and jags. Rides the bounce into the gully
round the wicket, outside off, an open-faced poke to backward point
eased out to the sweeper
forward and pressed into the covers
reaching for the ball outside off, and poked to point
a wristy drive to the cover sweeper, can't quite get to the pitch as Maxwell targets a wide line
banged in short, helped off the legs to backward square
very full, attacking the toes, nudged to the leg side
a hint of nip off the seam on a wide line, Hafeez has a swish but can't connect
pushed back into the crease, and defended on off stump
rapped on the hand by some extra lift, but they jog the single from the deflection
width outside off, flashed firmly through the gully
outside off, keeps a touch low as it scuds through to the keeper
angled down to third man
cracked to deep cover, attempting to put some humpty through the ball
leaning forward, solid defence on off stump
tip and run, pushed to cover
good wheels on an off-stump line, fenced out to point off the back foot
gallops out of the crease, and cracks a furious lofted drive through the covers! Who cares where it goes, so long as it goes!
on the legs, flicked to backward square
bunted into the leg side with a delicate deflected pull, kept lower than anticipated but watched it well
outside off, through to the keeper
a touch of width, nipping away from an open-faced dab through third man
fuller length on a wide line, muscled into the covers with oodles of bottom hand
more cunning nip off the seam. bending away to the keeper. Solid enough from the Professor
round the wicket, looped onto a good length, stabbed to cover
pushed with firm hands to point, no single there
a fraction shorter, a hurried cut, but can't place it past the fielder. A missed opportunity
finds the gap this time with a single to extra cover
angled bat, blocked to the off side
a flowing drive to long-off. Confident obduracy
good lift on a tight line, dead-batted down into the crease with a hop, but that's sharp awareness to steal the single
worked to the leg side, another well-stolen single
tremendous clumping drive! The spirit of Babar lives on! A fractional over-pitch, and the Professor lets his weight-transfer do the rest
back of a length, tighter line, hops into line to defend to the leg side
open faced drive out to point, tight lines from Richardson
fenced on the up to the point sweeper. Pakistan are still brawling here
over the wicket, turns appreciably into the right-hander, who meets it well on the back foot with an open-faced punch to cover
lofted into the toes, Hafeez drops to one knee on the sweep ... doesn't nail it, but places it square of the sweeper!
he's nailed that one! Ab-so-lute-ly massive, over long-on, with a semi-shimmy down the pitch and into the stands!
settles for the dab off the toes to the leg side
good footwork, advancing to meet the leg-stump line, and pushed with a full face to long-off
slower loopier delivery, into the toes, tucked to the leg side
130kph, back of a length, on off, he's back and working this through square leg
129kph, back of a length, he's up on his toes and square driving off the back foot through point
130kph, good length, fifth stump line, he is back and angling the bat, using the pace to run to third man
130kph, shorter length, on off, he's back and tucking this around the corner
short and wide and cracked past point! He waited on the width and thrashed it behind point. Cummins diving on the rope couldn't make the stop
130kph, angled well down the leg side and called wide
131kph, good length, he strides forward and punches a drive through cover
an edge flies through gully to third man. It was a good length, hint of shape away, he was caught on the crease and closing the face but the edge flies safe
146kph, full and straight, he hangs back in the crease and defends back to the bowler
139kph short ball, pulled in the air but safely forward of square for a single
143kph, full half volley, he drives very nicely straight to mid off
147kph, but slanting down the leg side and called wide
139kph, bouncer, well directed, he ducks under it early
full and straight, he drives to mid off with control
good length, top of off, he sits back and opens the face to run into the gully for a tight single. Maxwell fields and hits at the striker's but Imam is home
Imam charges and it's fired way down the leg side
short into the ribs and he is jumping back and tucking this square
130kph, back of a length on a fourth stump line, he's squared up a touch defending into the off side
131kph, fuller on off, he's back and defending from deep in the crease
131kph, back of a length on off, he's jumping back and defending
127kph, short and swinging too wide of off and rightly called
129kph, back of a length, hint of shape, he pushes off the back foot with an open face to wide third man
144kph, short ball directed at the body, he pulls awkwardly off the gloves towards fine leg along the ground
142kph, short of a length, off stump line, he's jumping back and defending onto the pitch
superb cut shot past backward point! Short and wide and he got on top of the bounce, thumping it through backward point to the rope
146kph, full, almost a yorker, he pushes on the front foot to mid on
141kph, good length, some width, he is back and running this to this man with control
high bouncer, Hafeez ducks, it was very high, Hafeez glared at the square leg umpire looking for a wide but there is no call
131kph, fuller, he drives slowly to mid off, Lyon, the sub, is on the circle and Imam beats him easily
short ball, he's back and pulling through forward square to the sweeper
134kph, good length, angled across, he's back and running this to third man
136kph, wide of the crease, angled into the top of off, he's back and working to mid on but Lyon is tight this time
full, on off, he pushes with nice timing back past the bowler for a couple
134kph, back of a length, he's back and defending into the on side
133kph, good length, nipping across and it beats the bat as he tries to defend
shorter on the hip, he's back and working this off the hip behind square
137kph, shorter wide of off, he's up on his toes cutting through cover-point to the man in the deep
play and miss as he got too close to a ball to cut. It was 139kph and it zipped off the surface
136kph, good length, he defends from the crease into the off side
141kph, fuller, on off, he drives firmly but back at Cummins who makes the stop
139kph, bouncer, he tried to hook but it took off and flew over his head. There were jeers from the crowd who thought it was wide
genuine edge through third slip, there's only one slip, Cummins had to dive at fine third man and lost his trousers making the save but he stopped the ball
good length, he opens the face and runs this with control to third man
play and miss again getting too close to cut a 134kph length ball
skips down the track and lofts this over mid off! He advanced to create a half volley, stayed leg side and lifted it over the top
shorter length, he's back and pulling this behind square

caught down the leg side! It was short down the leg side, would have been a wide if he left it, he tried to pull, got it off the glove and it floated through to Carey who took the catch easily! What a time to fall!
good length, nipping back, he is on the crease and defending late, getting it off the inner half of the bat to fine leg
143kph, good length wide of off, he sits back and dabs this neatly to third man
139kph, short and wide of off, he mistimes a cut to cover-point
140kph, bouncer, well directed, the skipper ducks low and under it easily
edged in the air but wide of gully and down to third man! He was driving on the up away from his body, sliced an edge wide of Marsh in the gully
sweep from off the stumps to wide fine leg! Clever shot. They have to attack him and this was a well executed sweep behind square
beaten and nearly stumped! He went outside leg, it drifted and dropped on him, he missed it, over balanced, Carey fumbled the take slightly and Sarfaraz just got his foot back down in time
drifting into leg, he's back and tucking this behind square
drifting in and sliding on, he's pushing this cover-point
drag down short ball, he's back and slapping a pull shot to deep midwicket

he's hit a full toss straight down deep square leg's throat! Finch makes the breakthrough! Oh no! This was a filthy full toss, it should have been hit to London, he just tried to place it, and hit it straight down Starc's throat on the rope, he held his nerve and took it. Finch raised both arms aloft sheepishly.
nearly a run out! Shoaib nearly run out without facing a ball! Srafaraz pushed to mid off, Warner swooped, Shoaib was slow to go, the throw was just wide but Shoaib was out if he hit. Goodness
140kph, full on off, he digs this out into the on side

caught behind! Brilliant catch from Carey. Cracking delivery. It was quick, a good length, nipping back off the seam and cut Shoaib in half, it caught the inside edge, Carey flung himself to his left and took a one-hander!
beaten prodding at a cracking delivery outside off stump!
136kph, back of a length outside off, he defends off the back foot pushing it to point
fuller on off, 141kph, he pushes neatly with the full face through straight mid on for a couple
drifting way down the leg side, Carey misses it, and they get two wides
drifting into leg stump, he tucks this behind square but can't get one
drifting into leg, he's back and working this through square leg
he steps way outside leg, cuts a ball from outside leg to cover
shorter on middle, he's back and punching this down to long on
flatter on middle, he's forcing this off the back foot to long on
flatter on middle, he stands tall and punches to long on
he walks outside off, working this through square leg, they push for two but can't get it
132kph, back of a length, he's back and late cutting this to third man
130kph, short ball, he pulls with control well forward of square and they get a couple
attempted cut, comes off the bottom edge and runs behind to to the keeper
131kph, shorter length, he's inside the line working this off the back foot behind square

caught behind! 134kph brute of a ball that took off from back of a length! It was a cross seam delivery outside off, it really climbed as he tried to run to third man, it caught the shoulder of the bat and flew through to Carey who took the catch head high
this is pushed down the leg side and called wide
good length on middle, he's back and forcing this to the gap at cover
tossed up on middle, he works this off the front foot behind square
shorter, with some bounce, he tucks this around the corner
fuller on leg, he just pushes to midwicket
edge past the keeper and there's no slip in! It was short and he gave room to cut but got a genuine edge that went fine and Warner could not chase it down
flatter on off, he defends on the front foot
fuller on off, he drives back to the bowler
135kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working this around the corner for a single
136kph, but sprayed down the leg side
good length, top of off, he defends from the crease into the off side
swatted over square leg! Wow! 133kph bouncer that was quite high, he reached and swatted it flat over the fence! Like he swatting a fly on the roof!
full in the arc and he swings through the line launching it high over long on! That was in the slot and he was ready. He hits a long ball!
big swing and miss outside off as there is some extra bounce
he charges down the track and squeezes it between bat and pad trying to heave away
short ball, he's back and pulling behind square to the sweeper
shorter length, he's back and forcing this firmly straight to cover
smashed over long on and way back! it was flat and fast, he cleared the front leg, off balance and smashed it miles over long on
full, he drives firmly along the ground to long on
shorter length, he's back and forcing this to the gap at cover-point
goodish length, 134kph/83mph angling in and worked to midwicket for a scampered single
wide, taking the pace off and Hasan's eyes are like saucers as he tries to blooter this into Dorset, fails to connect
pinged through the covers! Orthodox drive, high front arm and it skitters away... Play straight, lad, you'll not go wrong
short and wide, pace off again but Hasan latches on to a brutal slap over cover! Flayed over the ring and away, four more!

gottim, suckered with the bumper! Dug in and Hasan takes the bait, comes off the toe of the bat and Khawaja settles under it at fine leg. Hasan's merry jig is over, Richardson bouncing back from a bit of a pasting to claim his second wicket!
pitched up, 134kph/83mph and clipped on the drive to extra cover
over the wicket, pitched full on off and tapped into the off side half forward
fullish and worked off the pads, finds the gap at midwicket and they come scurrying back
short ball, 145kph/90mph from Starc but Sarfaraz is comfortable pulling a single
shuffles into line on off and tapped to extra cover
ouch, that's gonna hurt in the morning... short and spitting venom as Wahab fends it away with a combination of arm, glove and body
tight on off stump, Sarfaraz presses out and blocks
fired in straight, Wahab shows it a straight bat
dug in at the body, 142kph/88mph as Wahab backs off and fends to the leg side
fuller and met coming across, pushed into the covers
back of a length and Wahab works this around the corner for one
length ball outside off, 135kph/84mph and driven past backward point, who gets a hand on it but can't prevent a run
touch short of a length, blocked square with a slightly open bat face
short of a length outside off, Sarfaraz runs it down to third man
banged in and Wahab hops back, prods it down to the leg side
slings down another chest-high bumper, dealt with on the back foot
fuller now, tailing away at 144kph/89mph and slashed wide of slip for a boundary! Smith leapt to his right, but couldn't get near! Streaky but Pakistan'll take 'em how they come
full length and drilled into the covers
short of a length, 143kph/89mph and worked off the hip to fine leg
full outside off, nibbling in a fraction to clip the inside edge as Sarfaraz pushes forward
short of a length and nudged off the hip to fine leg
banged in, 135kph/84mph and Wahab fends it into the leg side for one
defended in front of the stumps
back of a length, 143kph/89mph and pushed down the track past the bowler, they hustle through for one
short but taking the pace off, Wahab has a massive yahoo across the line... and completely fails to connect
short and rising outside off, Sarfaraz dabs it behind backward pointq
slightly back of a length on the pads, slower ball and Wahab flips it uppishly into the leg side, they come scampering back for two
angled in straight, worked across the line for one more
length ball on middle and off, Sarfaraz defends
shortish and tapped down by the toes, they go for the quick single
woof, that's gone! Smoked into the crowd at deep backward square leg! Short ball and dealt with equally curtly (not Ambrose) by Wahab. Pakistan still in with a glimmer, here
plays away from his body, thick-edged wide of the keeper... Just one as third man comes around
back of a length, 137kph/85mph, Wahab jockeys across on off and defends
tapped down into the covers for a single
short, slower-ball bouncer down the leg side, Wahab flicks and misses - not called wide, though, much to the annoyance of the Pakistan contingent in the crowd
fullish, blocked square on the front foot
fired in straight and tucked into a gap at midwicket for one
dragged past off stump, just a scrap of bottom edge for four! Beats Carey and zips to the rope, you should be so lucky, Wahab!
smooshed into the stands at long-on! This is just a clean smack down the ground, carted for a straight six!
lobbed up and heaved over the leg side, looks to be bouncing away but Coulter-Nile pulls off a well-timed intervention on the rope! Just the single
pushed through and dabbed into the leg side
lobbed up and Wahab slugs it down the ground, bouncing in front of the man running around the rope
on the stumps, Sarfaraz nurdles out towards deep midwicket... can't get back for a second
length ball, squirted into a gap
shortish and slapped back down the track
six more, heaved over cow corner! Sweetly struck, Pakistan getting a moooooooove on now!
back of a length, Wahab waits and tucks it down behind square for one
angled in, 134kph/83mph and flicked behind square by Sarfaraz
full length, wide of the stumps and Wahab jabs down on it, squeezes one more to third man
over the wicket, speared full outside off, dab and a miss from the crease
slung down full on middle and leg, Wahab calmly works it through square off his pads
short of a length outside off, Sarfaraz ticks along with a glide to third man
round the wicket, short over the stumps at 148kph/92mph, Wahab gets into line
dug in, spiteful bumper and Wahab jumps, jerks and drops his hands! Decent ball, gets a respectful head wobble from Wahab, but he played it well
fired in full and whipped off the pads, one more to fine leg
slower ball, loops out as a full toss and Wahab dinks it behind square, Cummins is coming round at deep backward point, but he makes it back for two with a full-blooded dive!
pitched up and slashed off the outside edge to third man
shortish and worked off the body
short and wide, slapped through point off the back foot
early move across from Sarfaraz, miscues the pull to short midwicket... and Wahab then has to dive for his ground backing up!
short and room for a late slap to third man, just a single to finish the over
short ball neatly played, a back cut fine... but third man is well positioned to prevent more than a single

beats the bat, Wahab poking at it off the back foot, Carey and Starc like it! Not given by umpire Palliyaguruge, but Australia review with one second left on the countdown! Fencing off the back foot, well away from the body, if there was a sound it must have been bat... and there's a line on Ultra Edge! That's the breakthrough, Starc prises one out! Huge relief for Finch, who called for the DRS at the very last moment
over the wicket, dug in short and sliding leg side as Amir jerks under it... called wide
short of a length, 139kph/87mph and Amir pushes off the back foot and narrowly fails to nick off in near-identical fashion to Wahab

145kph/90mph full toss, Amir drags on! In no position to drive, all the weight going back and a thick inside edge judders the base of middle stump! Starc bringing the Mortal Kombat styles here, 'Finish him!'
pitched up, swinging late as Afridi pokes and gets an edge into his pads
pitched up and squirted off the pads through backward square
round the wicket, pitched full and tapped away
good length and he draws him out, nips this past the outside edge
short of a length, climbs to hit the splice as Afridi angles his bat
run out backing up! Maxwell seals it for Straya! Leaps to take the ball one-handed at short extra cover, then fires a throw at one-and-a-bit stumps to leave Sarfaraz well short! No dramas, mate
